title: Conor McGregor confirms he's setting up event for next fight after being 'blocked' by UFC
text:

Conor McGregor is ready to bypass the UFC "holding me back" by setting up his own charity event for his next fight.

The Notorious hasn't fought in the UFC since his controversial submission defeat to Khabib Nurmagomedov on October 6 last year, with his last victory coming almost three years ago.

McGregor has called out plenty of people since, including bitter rival Khabib, but his next battle looked like it would be a clash with Frankie Edgar in December.

But the Irishman has claimed Dana White and co have made it "difficult" for him, so instead he will fight without a prize purse and the UFC's influence on his own bill.

"Funny enough, I just want to compete now, the Irish former lightweight and featherweight champion said during an appearance in Ukraine.

(Image: Zuffa LLC via Getty Images)

"I was trying the December 14th card, for whatever reason they've been holding me back.

"I'm giving them dates, I'm saying I want to fight this date, this date, this date, this date in a row.

"We had opponents selected and everything and they're just making it very difficult for me for whatever reason.

"So now I'm kind of in a position where I'm attempting to set up a charity event.

(Image: Getty Images)

"I've done this before in my hometown but I done it in an amateur boxing event at my old boxing club, Crumlin Boxing Club, but I want to do mixed martial arts competition also.

"Create an event, find an opponent, compete, zero prize. I do not care about the prize. The prize is in my home.

"I have five prizes in my home that I seek to get, I've got them.

(Image: Zuffa LLC via Getty Images)

"I just want to compete now, I want to come back, I want to get sharp, I want to show the best of myself and continue to climb. So that's why I am seeking to do.

"So we are looking to do that sometime in December, hopefully have a charity mixed martial arts event for zero prize.

"The prize will go to charity, so that's what we are aiming for."
description: Conor McGregor hasn't fought for over a year, since his Khabib Nurmagomedov loss, and has seemingly fallen out with the UFC
